you to connect this entire project to
something like Perforce or Diversion or
several other revision control uh
systems. And what that's going to do is
keep track of the changes for every
single file in the project, who's
messing with what files when you check
in or check out changes. You keep the
version history. So if you like, you
know, yesterday's version and you made
some mistakes today, you can roll it
back. Things like that. It's it's just
really smart backups and sort of version
control for your entire project. So
realistically in a production
